title: @ Riot, Taliyah's Login Theme is Amazing
body:
I don't know exactly how it was made, but 
**it
is
amazing.**

The highs and lows of the piece really bring you along into the spirit of Taliyah and Shurima and I think accomplishing that for at least me is magnificent. 

 Cough up the designer for this, I must know to further fan-girl over the beauty.

{{champion:127}} FlyingBuntcake
P.S.-  listening to it for the 5th time while writing this with a tear in my eye

replies.body:
Super happy that you are enjoying her theme! :)
I really wanted to convey the journey that she's on, while reflecting her youth, optimism, and strength.

(Context: Ultimate goal of working at Riot)
Quick question:
Would **AP Music Theory** be a good class to take to get into the music side of Riot?

> [{quoted}](name=Flying Buntcake,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=v1AHEZfg,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-05-12T00:39:04.868+0000)
>
> (Context: Ultimate goal of working at Riot)
> Quick question:
> Would **AP Music Theory** be a good class to take to get into the music side of Riot?

While AP Music Theory can help further your musical knowledge, it does not guarantee that you'd get into Riot or be successful at composing. Education is always good though. It usually comes down to a mix of hard work, experience, talent, and passion. If you have the chance to take AP Music Theory though, go for it! :)

I phrased the question like I was asking if it would be a direct thing or something haha. < bad phrasing
but yeah, "If you have the chance to take AP Music Theory though, go for it! :)" , I definitely will.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Do you play any instruments?

It usually comes down to a mix of hard work, experience, talent, and passion. If you have the chance to take AP Music Theory though, go for it! :)

Awesome. Love seeing Riot respond to crap that doesn't matter instead of having the balls to respond to the countless and popular threads about things like Tank Ekko, and how god awful stupid the whole thing is.  

Good job.
+1 from me too. its one of the few login themes i have just listened to just for the music itself, sometimes play it on my bus ride to uni, bravo

Taliyah's theme is so absolutely on point that from the first five seconds i immediately thought 'yep this is her, and it's gonna be good.'

Also it's got such a good vibe to it. Like.... Strong, adventurous, and upbeat. Kudos to whoever created this score.
For me, it tells the story of Shurima and Taliyah's journey back to her family.
